newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China food processor Ruyi to launch IPO.
newsitem.headline: China food processor Ruyi to launch IPO.

text.p: Food processor Lianyungang Ruyi Group Co Ltd said on Monday it was set to launch an initial public offer of 11.54 million A shares on November 6.

The offer has been approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission and will be launched via the Shenzhen bourse's automated quotation system at 3.88 yuan per share, Ruyi said in a prospectus published in the official Securities Times.
The issue provides a P/E ratio of 20.97 times based on forecast per-share net of 0.19 yuan under diluted basis for 1996, it said.
Ruyi said it has also been given approval by the CSRC to list 960,000 staff shares, placed at one yuan per share in 1994, along with the A shares in Shenzhen.
Jiangsu Provincial Securities has been named the offer's chief underwriter and Ruyi's listing promoter, it said.
Ruyi said it plans to funnel the share offer proceeds into its core business, food processing.
It said it would use part of the money to set up a US$5.50 million frozen food venture with two Japanese companies with Ruyi holding a 30 percent stake in the project.
